Colombian Association of Sports Medicine throws support behind James Rodriguez

Former Colombia doctor Hector Fabio Cruz caused a bit of a stir lately when he described James Rodriguez as being "bad in the head," but the Colombian Association of Sports Medicine have offered a defence of the playmaker.

"The Association wants to express its disagreement with the statement of the Doctor," they said through a press release.

"It completely lacks academic content or scientific relevance to a specific injury.

"It doesn't represent in any way the opinion of the medical staff of the national team."

Arsenal were knocked back in Vinicius approach

Real Madrid rebuffed Arsenal's efforts to sign Vinicius Junior over the summer, reports UOL.

Edu is said to have asked the Blancos about a fellow Brazilian, but was made aware that the 19-year-old forward is not for sale.

https://esporte.uol.com.br/futebol/ultimas-noticias/2019/09/04/como-selecao-pode-ajudar-vinicius-jr-no-real-apos-procura-de-psg-e-arsenal.amp.htm?__twitter_impression=true

Here is some Real Madrid transfer news -- of sorts. Los Blancos had been worried they would not be allowed to register Rodrygo for the first-team squad this season despite signing the young forward from Santos this summer in a deal worth €54m.

The problem was that they already had all three of their places for non-EU players taken up by Uruguayan Federico Valverde and Brazilian duo Vinicius Jr. and Eder Militao.

However, Spanish broadcaster La Sexta reports that Valverde managed to obtain a Spanish passport before the Sept. 2 deadline, opening up a space for young Brazilian forward Rodrygo in the senior squad and avoiding him being consigned to a season with the club's B team.

replies.msg: Benzema on his Champions League Final goal against Liverpool: “I needed that goal. The emotions I felt after scoring this goal was one of the best - took me back when I was very young and played football. For me, the Champions League is like the World cup - but harder to win.”

Benzema on his piece of art against Atlético: “This is in fact how I define football. If I’m a fan who goes out to the stadium, I want to see this because you’re always going to see goals but things like that don’t happen everyday and against an opponent like Atlético.” [rmc]


Florentino on Benzema’s play against Atlético: “It is a play that is not only in the history of Real Madrid, but in the history of world football. It is an action that would have its place in the museum of Prado or the Louvre.”

Bale: “Football is my No 1 sport. I’m paid to do it and I always give my best. Golf is a hobby like anyone else would have a lobby. There is nothing wrong with having a round. People make a lot of it, but a lot of footballers play it and it’s one thing I really enjoy.”

Zidane's lack of a set system continues to confuse

Almost six month after Zinedine Zidane's return, Real Madrid continue without a system or a set starting team. Madrid have shown the same symptoms of uncertainty, inconsistency and lack of automation between the players that they did before the French manager came back. Zidane has tried different formations (4-3-3, 4-4-2, 4-2-3-1 and a three-man defense in preseason) but none of them have alleviated the problems that persist, particularly against opposition counter-attacks -- 13 counters per game -- along with an unbalanced attack.

Florentino Pérez opened the General Assembly of Delegate Members 2019 by paying tribute to the members & other madridistas who passed away, incl. executive Ángel Luis Heras Aguado, Bernabéu delegate Agustín Herrerín and various former football and basketball players.


Perez at the General Assembly of Delegate Members: “This is a united club & that's our strength, the strength of madridismo. We have to understand that this team had won everything there was to win in a unique and historic cycle which saw us lift 17 titles in the last 9 seasons”

Perez: “I must recall that when I came back to take on the presidency in 2009, we sat at 13th in the UEFA ranking. Today, Real Madrid are still the Club World Champions, as we have been since 18 December 2016, that's, 1,001 successive days”.

Perez: “Every year we break our own revenue records. Last season, 18-19, our operating revenues hit 757 million euros, surpassing those of the previous season. During the period 2000-2019, revenues have grown at an average rate of 10.5% per year.”

Perez: “Real Madrid is the most valuable sports club acc to Forbes. It tops the Deloitte ranking of highest-revenue clubs for a 12th year & leads transparency ratings of CL & LaLiga clubs. It's the most popular team acc to Google & the best football club acc to France Football”

‘Zidane likes my brother, everyone knows it’ – Pogba sees fresh Real Madrid transfer hint dropped

“I like Zidane and he likes my brother, everyone knows it.”

Mathias Pogba insists that has never been an issue, with the speculation which surrounds his brother considered to be nothing new.

He added: “It has been normal for my family, we do not care what is spoken about in the media.”
